detailed_info.name: Propylparaben
detailed_info.description:
Propylparaben is a synthetic ingredient used as a preservative in cosmetics. It is also present in foodstuffs (E216) for the same purpose (jams, drinks, sauces, etc.).

Although the European Scientific Committee states in its latest opinion of 2021: "Available data on propylparaben provide indications of its potential endocrine effects. However, the current level of evidence is not sufficient to consider it as an endocrine disrupting substance, nor to establish a toxicological starting point based on its endocrine disrupting properties, usable in human health risk assessment", we believe, insofar as it is possible not to use it and therefore to do otherwise, and applying the precautionary principle, that this ingredient should be avoided in cosmetic products. For these reasons, it is accompanied by a red flower on our application.
detailed_info.regulation:
The maximum concentration allowed in ready-to-use cosmetic preparations is:
- 0.14% (in acid) for the sum of the individual concentrations

- 0,8% (as acid) for the mixtures of substances mentioned in Nos. 12 and 12a, the sum of the individual concentrations of butylparaben and propylparaben and their salts not exceeding 0,14%

Do not use in non-rinsing products intended to be applied on the seat area of children under three years of age.

Wording of conditions of employment and warnings:
For non-rinse products designed for children under three:
"Do not use on the seat area."

functions.name: Preservative
functions.description: Inhibits the development of microorganisms in cosmetic products.

functions.name: Perfuming
functions.description: Used for perfume and aromatic raw materials
